Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Jenn was a fantastic resource and oftentimes found that she was the best resource to contact in terms of logistics, organization, and overall class topics. She was incredible!
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Jenn was great - very hands-on, always helpful and very knowledgeable.
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Great TA!
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Jennifer Hoyle
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Great TA! Always ready to help us in need.
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  THe amazing Jenn Hoyle!
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  jennifer hoyle
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Jennifer Hoyle
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Jennifer Hoyle

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: N/A
Great class, never pass an opportunity to take a class with Brad and Mark.
Strong focus on stormwater, weaker discussion of frameworks for PES.
Very much an independent research, capston course in every way.Gives students a great opportunity to consolidate all they have learned in other classes .

Question 14: My interests aren't directly tied to stormwater management or green infrastructure, but I found the concepts and approach quite useful nevertheless in terms of building my general knowledge.Question 6: Jenn was terrific - always prepared, very accessible, and ever enthusiastic.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The field trips! By far I learned the most when we traveled to the respective cities.
Learning more about the stormwater management concepts and working with yale facilities to develop an actual, working plan for the university
The field trip, the client work, the group work, the exposure to such a wide variety of GI programs.
The field trips and discussions were excellent.
The field trip to the East Coast Cities was an amazing, unique experience.Working with a team on the Yale Stormwater Plan and the City profiles was a great opportunity.
Ability to engage directly with GI professionals and use information to help Yale.

- The practical application opportunities and chance to make a tangible difference- The group work - not many FES classes have this much group work and I really enjoyed getting to work with a lot of different students- It was very student-driven, which provided lots of opportunity for self-direction

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: More consistency from the leadership team - it was confusing who was in charge, directing what was to be submitted for deliverables, etc.
more focus on going over some basic concepts, theories and ideas before jumping into developing a plan for the university and recommending to facilities what to do
Maybe a more clear definition of class structure from the beginning.
Would have been nice to hold students accountable for the readings.
A bit more guidance on expectations upfront would lay a clearer path for the course requirements.
N/A

I think maybe spending even just the first class providing a 30,000 foot overview of stormwater management, green infrastructure, and how it fits into the Yale context would be super helpful to get those of us unfamiliar with it up to speed.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A
No discussion section.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Jenn was great

Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Jenn was a great TA. very supportive, cultivated good discussion and good critical thinking, helpful but hands-off as a personnel manager. Organized, efficient, awesome.
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Strong involvement in organization.

Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Jenn is absolutely one of the brightest and most personable people I have ever met.She was always available when guidance was needed and showed incredible leadership and organizational skills throughout the entire course. She is an excellent, clear, confident teacher and researcher. We were so fortunate to have her as our TA.!
Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Jenn is an outstanding and competent TA. she's organized, thorough, and supportive.

Instructor: Jennifer Burlingame Hoyle Fair  Jenn, as stated above, was amazing. She provided great insights when needed, was always prepared, seemed to know everything about everyone's respective contributions/assignments, and always had a positive attitude. She should just keep it up!

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: It was a good introduction to a concept and problems i wasn't familiar with before.
Less as a capstone and more as an investigation of payments for ecosystem services.

This course gave me an unexpected new direction and knowledge base for my career.It tied together the critical aspects of stormwater management in an age of unpredictable climate changes, with the preservation and remediation of high functioning ecosystems necessary for sustainable land use planning in our cities.
I took this course mostly to be exposed to a new area of broader interest (ecosystem services) and to be able to apply learnings to an actual project.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: to learn more about stormwater management and to fulfill requirements

I have a strong interest in ecosystem services and this was a perfect opportunity to apply the concept to our changing weather patterns and the impact on our urban landscapes.The class was also a great chance to participate in a class co-taught by Brad Gentry and Mark Ashton. What a great class!
the subject interested me
See above.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
In certain ways, the practical learning from the course far outweighed the academic learning.
Absolutely,!
yes
For the most part. I wish I gained a deeper understanding of the technical aspects of some of the green infrastructure solutions, but time didn't allow for it.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Overall - good experience. A bit challenging in times
Group work is hard! but an important skill to learn. Really appreciated the personal review of how I am as a group mate. Hope the responses to that are distributed.
As always, hard to negotiate schedules.
Teams allowed us to each bring our own experience and expertice to the projects.

We participated in multiple work groups. The advantages were the diversity of background/experience people brought and the chance to get to work with many different classmates on different aspects of the project. No disadvantages.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: It is a good course - expect a good amount of work and tons of research on your own
Absolutely critical that the course subject matter matches your goals.
Enjoy every minute! It is a unique learning experience!
assuming the course continues to focus on Yale, it's a great way to get to know how Yale works and get to know and learn from two of the best professors at FES.

Outstanding instructors who provide a great balance of self-directed study and guided lessons where needed.Chance to work on a practical project that will make a tangible difference for a client.Ability to get your hands dirty in a topic of increasing concern in urban design.Significant field trip requirements.Must be self-motivated in order to complete quality deliverables on time.
